column1: Table 1: Museums and Galleries Monthly Visits (revisions on previous data are highlighted in red)
HORNIMAN MUSEUM (Excluding visits to the Garden)
IWM London redevelopment: the museum closed to the public on 1 January 2013, partially re-opening on 29 July 2013, and was closed from 6 January-19 July 2014.
The Research Room remained open during the temporary closure periods.
There were no visit figures collected for HMS Belfast between December 2011 and May 2012 due to it being closed between these times.
The D-Day Anniversary Airshow in May 2014 attracted 22,000 visitors and the Flying Legends Airshow in July 2014 attracted 28,000 visitors
NATIONAL COAL MINING MUSEUM FOR ENGLAND
SCIENCE MUSEUM GROUP NATIONAL MEDIA MUSEUM
SCIENCE MUSEUM GROUP NATIONAL RAILWAY MUSEUM
Visit numbers increased in July 2013 due to a visit by HRH Prince Charles and Mallard 75 events. Visit numbers increased in October-November 2013 due to further Mallard 75 events.
SCIENCE MUSEUM GROUP  LOCOMOTION AT SHILDON
Visit numbers increased in February 2014 due to Mallard 75 events.
SCIENCE MUSEUM GROUP MUSEUM OF SCIENCE AND INDUSTRY, MANCHESTER
As of 2012-13 the Museum of Science and Industry in Manchester became part of the Science Museum Group
Science Museum Group Swindon (Wroughton) is a storage facility and is only open by appointment
(RA) WHITE TOWER (BASED AT THE TOWER OF LONDON)
Figures have been collected from 2012-13 when a clicker counter was installed at the entrance.
Tate St Ives was closed to the public from 27 January-16 May 2014 to complete the Tate St Ives Phase 2 capital project.
Please note that numbers can vary due to weather conditions, as this is an open air facility.
The museum is closed from October-March, except for pre-arranged school and group visits, and Christmas events.
The museum was closed from 23-27 December 2013 and on 1 January 2014
The Hancock Museum closed and re-opened as the Great North Museum (below)
The museum was closed from 23-27 December 2013 and on 1 January 2014
The museum was closed from 23 December 2013 to 6 January 2014
Please note that the Washington F Pit is only open in the summer months and is dependent on weather conditions on being open to the public.
The museum was closed from 23 December 2013 to 13 January 2014
The museum was closed from 23 December 2013 to 7 January 2014
The museum was closed from 23 December 2013 to 6 January 2014
The Hatton Gallery has been managed by Tyne and Wear Museum since October 2008. Figures prior to this are not available.
The museum was closed from 21 December 2013 to 6 January 2014
The museum is open at weekends and Bank Holidays from April to October and all week during school holidays (excluding Christmas Holidays).
There were Christmas events at the museum each weekend from 31 November-22 December 2013.
The museum was closed from 23 December 2013 to 6 January 2014
(T&W) MUSEUM STORE (SHARED BY T&W AND BEAMISH MUSEUM)
The Beamish Museum is a storage facility and has been closed to the general public since November 2010
*The Museum of Childhood was closed for refurbishment between November 2005 and December 2006.
The Theatre Museum closed in September 2007
Since April 2008 the Museum of London has been sponsored by the Greater London Authority. This data is now compiled by the GLA.
